result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Phillip R Brandt was found guilty of OWI (5th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.

miscConds.notes: Pay $1600 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 2/12/15. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 2/12/15, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. Report forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Phillip R Brandt in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but will read in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Court orders Defendant to submit DNA sample. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Phillip R Brandt in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for plea hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
from Defense requesting plea hearing be scheduled in early November
Status conference on November 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Phillip R Brandt in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of Defendant's mother's health issues, requests status conference in August, hopes to have Defendant enter plea in November.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
from Defense requesting rescheduling
Status conference on May 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
adding Count 2

Defendant Phillip R Brandt in court with attorney Brett E. Reetz.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that offer has been accepted, requests status to allow Defendant time to care for his ailing mother.  Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea.  Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 12/26/13.
by State
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Bond continues as is.

Defendant Phillip R Brandt in court with attorney Brett E. Reetz.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Arraignment scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Phillip R Brandt appeared by video conference.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/6/14, 10:00.
